availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund C. Starks (Calloway County, KY, resident)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of William M. Starks and Eliza Starks. Resident of Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Attended school in Calloway County in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from October 23, 1862, to October 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 484A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 862.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 220.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 229A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 135.
"Edmund Curd Starks (1845-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 100252985, accessed May 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100252985.
